intro: Teuscheria venezuelana, commonly known as the Venezuelan teuscheria, is a flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species in botanical studies.
